Activity: Log in, check emails. Hopefully, the goals for the week will be in my inbox from @PROD-1. If not, I'll send a follow-up email.
Assuming I have the goals: Review the assigned goals and break them down into smaller, manageable tasks. Create a detailed task list with estimated timeframes for each.
Prioritize the tasks based on dependencies and overall project milestones. Identify any critical path items that need immediate attention.
Start working on the highest priority task. This might involve implementing a new feature, debugging an existing issue, or conducting code reviews.
Continue working on the task, regularly testing and debugging the code to ensure functionality and stability. Create test case for new gameplay functions.

Hold a brief stand-up meeting with the client development team (@CDEV-1, @CDEV-2, @CDEV-3) to discuss progress, challenges, and any dependencies that might be blocking their work. Review the tasks for the three developers and suggest improvements.

Update task progress in the project management system and document any important findings or decisions made during the day. Send the summary to @PROD-1 and @LDES-1 to ensure they understand today's working process
Prepare for the next day by outlining the tasks and priorities. Review any relevant documentation or code samples to ensure a smooth start.
